resources.string:
Instructions:
1. Enter your trainer level
2. Press the start button and allow screen capture
3. Open up your desired Pokémon in 'Pokémon Go'
4. Tap the IV Button to scan the Pokémon
5. Adjust the scanned data if necessary
6. Check IV!

string-array.name: valor_percentage
string-array.item: "…not be great …but I still like it"

resources.string: Use the slider below to align the arc:
Launch Pokémon Go when GoIV is started
Show a screen which allows you to manually edit the scanned information before showing results
Save battery life by scanning screenshots instead of auto detecting. This setting has to be enabled for Android KitKat and below. Warning! In this mode the GoIV button does not auto appear
Automatically delete screenshots taken by GoIV
Automatically add scanned information to your copy & paste clipboard.
Help the developers improve the application by sending anonymous crash-related information to them and completely anonymous usage stats
Automatically check for updates when the app is being used
See if an update is available
Scanning failed, please scroll up and try again!
Power up and evolution calculation\nDrag the level slider to view different predictions
Increase IV calculation precision by leveling up and comparing two scans of the same Pokémon
There are no possible combinations. Make sure the values you have entered are correct.
An error occurred while checking for an update. Please check your internet connection
An update for GoIV is already being downloaded

The percentage shows how big the difference is between your Pokémon and a Pokémon of the same species which has perfect IVs.\n\nSo for example, if it says 92 percent, then your Pokémon maxes out at 8 percent less CP compared to the same species with maximum IVs.
Show how many you can evolve
This feature enables scanning for candy amount and allows you to see how many Pokémon you can evolve, useful for use with lucky egg
Drag the window by this handler to relocate it.
Please choose a token to add from the scrollable list.
Define how you want the clipboard result to look.
Display translated Pokémon name on GoIV but use its English name for OCR. This is for when the Pokémon Go app is in English but user\'s native language is not
Waiting for Pokémon Go to start...
Allows you to define another setting for Copy to clipboard in Edit which will show a different result when a scan returns a single possibility.
View application credits, used open source projects and thanks

GoIV has detected that your phone does not have the MediaProjection API, which is used to automatically show the IV scan button. This might be fixed by updating your phone to Android 5 or above. The app will lock itself to screenshot mode to avoid crashing. You can use GoIV by manually triggering a screenshot, which most devices does by holding home+power for a short duration. We apologize for the inconvenience.
" This token is a max evolution variant, meaning that it will return a result as if your Pokémon was already fully evolved, which might be more interesting in a lot of cases."
Custom separator can\'t contain . because the developer is lazy

"Returns how many percent of the iv combinations your Pokémon is compared to all other possible IV combinations. The distribution for IVs is not even, there are a lot of different combinations that can result in 20 IVs (Like 5,5,10 or 10,5,5) but there is only one resulting in 45. The closer to 0 the result is, the better it is."

"This token gives you an idea of how powerful this pokemon can become, by measuring the maximum possible CP the pokemon can obtain. So for example, A lapras can max out at 2980 CP, while a dugtrio would max out at 1168 CP. So Lapras would get A while Dugtrio would get E-. This tier is adjusted based on the IV of your pokemon."
"Represents the Pokémon IVs in a base 16 number system. This means that each IV can be represented by a single character. So for example, a pokemon with IVs 10, 13, 3 would be represented as AD3."
Get how much hp the Pokémon has at the current level.
Get how much hp the Pokémon will have at max level.

"Get the %1$s percent of the IV possibilities. If only one iv combination is possible, minimum, average and maximum will be the same. For example, if the iv range is 55-75, the minimum will return 55, the average will return something between 55 and 75, and the maximum will return 75."

This token represents the level of the Pokémon, as it was scanned, times 2. This avoids decimals, which makes the text longer, but does not lose information like removing the decimal does. For example, if the Pokémon is level 10.5, this will return 21.
This token represents the level of the Pokémon, as it was scanned, but removes the decimal. This potentially loses information. For example, a level 10.5 Pokémon will return 10.

This token represents the level of the Pokémon, as it was scanned, including the decimal. This makes the output longer than the alternatives, but is very accurate. For example, a level 10.5 pokemon will return as 10.5.
"This token shows the level of the pokemon as one or two unicode tokens, the first to show the whole level such as ⑰, and if the pokemon is half-leveled, also adds a ½."

This token calculates how close your Pokémon is to its max potential, measured by CP. For example, if a Pokémon with max IVs maxes out at 2000cp, but your specific pokemon maxes out at 1900, then your pokemon perfection is 95%, so this token returns 95.
"This token returns the name of the Pokemon, for example if you scan a Dratini, it will return %1$s ."
"%1$s With the number cap, the length of the Pokémon name can not exceed %2$d characters long."
Shows how many power-ups are left until pokemon would reach level 40. For example if the pokemon is level 15, there are 25 levels to level 40, which is 50 powerups.
"This is simply a character you can put inbetween the smarter tokens to make the result more readable. The character you have chosen is: %1$s"
This token gives you a representation fo your pokemon IVs, but using UNICODE special characters which allows you to show numbers like 10 as a single character, like ⑪. This saves space.
%1$s This token is the filled version, which has a black inside for the numbers, like ⓭.
%1$s This token is the empty version, which has a white inside for the numbers, like ⑪.

"This token gives you the base stats of the pokemon, such as 186 190 260 for lapras, which means that this pokemon without IV bonuses has 186 attack, 190 defense and 260 stamina. IVs can dd an extra 15 to each stat."
%1$s This version of the token also adds the IV score so you can see the total for this specific pokemon.
%1$s This specific version of the token only displays one of the stats.
